message:
Any recommendation for a lightweight responsive design CSS framework? 

So far the ones I found that are promising.
1- PureCSS
2- Skeleton

A little bit of background, I am trying to add some mobile friendliness to some existing web pages, the web app is pretty complex that rewriting it with a full blown framework like bootstrap is unrealistic, especially that mobile support is only needed in one or two pages.

data.message: How about customizing the media queries by yourself? I think this would be better solution

I guess I can always resort to that, but to be honest my experience in this part is very limited especially in deciding the right threshold values for each type of devices, if you have a good cheatsheet or guide that would be awesome
Let me check once I reach home
Twitter Bootstrap

I would recommend you try to apply the media queries yourself.. If not then try a responsive grid system only.. If not then I would recommend Pure. I didn't use it before but i've alwayes liked it
And in all cases I will be more than happy to help :)
Twitter Bootstrap is awesome, but for my case it is too much
Muhammad Saleh I liked Pure because it is modular, so I can only use grid system if I want.
